title: A JSON Schema for Swagger 2.0 API.

swagger.description: The Swagger version of this document.

host.description: The host (name or ip) of the API. Example: 'swagger.io'

basePath.description: The base path to the API. Example: '/api'.

consumes.description: A list of MIME types accepted by the API.

produces.description: A list of MIME types the API can produce.

$ref.description: Swagger $ref's should only point to objects immediatly under #/definitions, #/parameters, and #/responses.

title.description: A unique and precise title of the API.

version.description: A semantic version number of the API.

description.description: A longer description of the API. Should be different from the title.  GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

termsOfService.description: The terms of service for the API.

contact.description: Contact information for the owners of the API.

name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

url.description: The URL pointing to the contact information.

email.description: The email address of the contact person/organization.

name.description: The name of the license type. It's encouraged to use an OSI compatible license.

url.description: The URL pointing to the license.

paths.description: Relative paths to the individual endpoints. They must be relative to the 'basePath'.

definitions.description: One or more JSON objects describing the schemas being consumed and produced by the API.

parameterDefinitions.description: One or more JSON representations for parameters

responseDefinitions.description: One or more JSON representations for responses

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the HTTP message.

summary.description: A brief summary of the operation.

description.description: A longer description of the operation, GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

operationId.description: A unique identifier of the operation.

produces.description: A list of MIME types the API can produce.

consumes.description: A list of MIME types the API can consume.

responses.description: Response objects names can either be any valid HTTP status code or 'default'.

vendorExtension.description: Any property starting with x- is valid.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.
Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

allowEmptyValue.description: allows sending a parameter by name only or with an empty value.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

allowEmptyValue.description: allows sending a parameter by name only or with an empty value.

required.description: Determines whether or not this parameter is required or optional.

in.description: Determines the location of the parameter.

description.description: A brief description of the parameter. This could contain examples of use.  GitHub Flavored Markdown is allowed.

schema.description: A deterministic version of a JSON Schema object.

schema-dynamic-allowed.description: A deterministic version of a JSON Schema object which allows dynamic schema extensions.

not.description: Note: VS Code seems to be allowing 'file' for the type but it shouldn't. Explicitly denying it here seems to produce the correct results though.

fileSchema.description: A deterministic version of a JSON Schema object.

format.description:
Swagger data types plus some Power Platform extensions:
- `date-no-tz` - Represents an date-time that has no time-offset (ABNF: `full-date 'T' partial-time`).
- `html` - Tells clients to emit html editor when editing and html viewer when viewing.

parametersList.description: The parameters needed to send a valid API call.

schemesList.description: The transfer protocol of the API.

x-ms-api-annotation<operation>.description: Used for versioning and life cycle management of an operation.

family.title: Operation family
family.description: Often the operationId of the first version of an operation.

value-collection.description: A path string that evaluates to an array of objects in the response payload. If value-collection isn't specified, the response is evaluated as an array.

value-title.description: A path string in the object inside value-collection that refers to the value's description.

value-path.description: A path string in the object inside value-collection that refers to the parameter value.

operationId.description: The operation that returns the values.

x-ms-dynamic-list.description: Specifies how the Power Automate designer can provide values for a parameter at design time by calling another operation to get a list of values.

operationId.description: The operation that returns the values.

itemsPath.description: A path string that evaluates to an array of objects in the response payload. If`itemsPath`isn't provided, the response is evaluated as an array.

itemTitlePath.description: A path string in the object inside`itemsPath`that refers to the value's description.

itemValuePath.description: A path string in the object inside`itemsPath`that refers to the items value.

x-ms-dynamic-schema.description: Specifies how the Power Automate designer can provide values for a parameter at design time by calling another operation to get a list of values.

operationId.description: The operation that returns the schema.

value-path.description: A path string that refers to the property that has the schema.If not specified, the response is assumed to contain the schema in the root object's properties.

x-ms-dynamic-properties.description: Specifies how the Power Automate designer can provide values for a parameter at design time by calling another operation to get a list of values.

operationId.description: The operation that returns the schema.

itemValuePath.description: A path string that refers to the property that has the schema.If not specified, the response is assumed to contain the schema in the root object.

DynamicOperationCall-parameters.description: An object that provides the input parameters to invoke the operation. Each property is the name of a parameter on the target operation.

parameter.description: The name of the parameter to use from the caller as the value for the dynamic call.

DynamicOperationCall-parameters-literals.description: An object that provides the input parameters to invoke the operation. Each property is the name of a parameter on the target operation.

DynamicOperationCall-parameters<x-ms-cap.description: An object that provides the input parameters to invoke the operation. Each property is the name of a parameter on the target operation.

additionalProperties.description: Any literal json value, with support for referencing a parameter or property.

parameter.description: The name of the parameter to use from the caller as the value for the dynamic call.

DynamicOperationCall-parameters-value-or.description: An object that provides the input parameters to invoke the operation. Each property is the name of a parameter on the target operation.

value.description: The literal value to be used for the input parameter.

parameterReference.description: This is the full parameter reference path, starting from the parameter name, followed by the path string of the property to be referenced. e.g. 'body/appId'.

x-ms-pageable.description: This extension configures an operation to be pageable.

nextLinkName.description:
The name of the property at the root of the response that has the next link url.
Usage: Be sure to use the policy template (id: `updatenextlink`) to enable the correct routing of this link.

value.title: The value in the /enum array of the parent schema object for this enum value item.

displayName.title: The text to display in user interfaces for this enum value. This text is localizable.

x-ms-safe-operation.title: Explicitly indicates whether this operation is HTTP Safe
x-ms-safe-operation.description: By default, only HTTP methods GET and HEAD are 'safe by default'. Setting this on an operation like a POST will tell clients that it's safe.

x-ms-summary.title: Specifies the title for an entity

x-ms-test-value.title: A sample value to use when running a test
x-ms-test-value.description:
The value should be a valid value for this entity.
DO NOT include any secrets, keys, or personally identifiable data.

x-ms-visibility.title: Specifies the user-facing visibility for an entity.

x-ms-url-encoding.title: Encoding style to use for this parameter
x-ms-url-encoding.description: Identifies if the current path parameter should be double url-encoded `double` or single url-encoded `single`. Absence of this field means `single` encoding.

testConnection.description: Note: This feature is currently not supported for custom connectors.

AutoRest-x-ms-parameter-location.description: NOTE: This extension is ignored by the Power Platform. The schema is only provide here for convenience. See: http://azure.github.io/autorest/extensions/

AutoRest-x-ms-skip-url-encoding.description: NOTE: This extension is ignored by the Power Platform. The schema is only provide here for convenience. See: http://azure.github.io/autorest/extensions/

AutoRest-x-ms-enum.description: NOTE: This extension is ignored by the Power Platform. The schema is only provide here for convenience. See: http://azure.github.io/autorest/extensions/
